EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (0.0, 0.0)) [Contains coal (7); Producing iron-plate (43 units); Warning: no ingredients to smelt]
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: (–16.0, –51.0)) [Warnings: out of fuel; output blocked by item on the ground; no sink entity present]
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –49.5))
  • Pickup: (–15.5, –49.5)
  • Drop: (–13.5, –49.5) [Warnings: out of fuel]
– Transport Belt (position: (–15.5, –49.5))
– Iron Chest (position: (–13.5, –49.5))
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –47.5))
  • Pickup: (–15.5, –47.5)
  • Drop: (–13.5, –47.5) [Status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS]
– Fast Inserter (position: (–12.5, –49.5)) [Warning: not receiving electricity]
– Sink Inserter (position: (–13.5, –45.5))
  • Pickup: (–13.5, –46.5)
  • Drop: (–13.5, –44.5)
– Belt Group connecting fast inserter drop (–11.5, –49.5) to sink inserter pickup (–13.5, –46.5)

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (–27.0, –60.0)) [Contains fuel: wood (4); Producing copper-plate (37 units); Warning: no ingredients to smelt]

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research with integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab (position: (0.5, 2.5)) [Status: NO_POWER; Contains automation-science-pack (23)]
– Offshore Pump (original) (position: (–7.5, 25.5))
– Offshore Pump (new) (position: (–9.5, 24.5)) connected to Boiler
– Boiler (position: (2.0, 17.5)) [Warnings: out of fuel; no input liquid; congestion near connection at (2.5, 21.5)]
– Steam Engine (Generator) (position: (2.5, 27.5)) [Warnings: no input liquid; NOT_CONNECTED]

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: (3.5, 0.5)) [Warnings: not receiving electricity; cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate (1)]
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))
– Electricity network via Small Electric Poles at various positions

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of:
– Multiple Pipe Groups distributed across the map (e.g., at positions such as (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), (–1.5, 21.5), etc.)
– A Pipe Group linking Offshore Pump (new) at (–9.5, 24.5) to Boiler at (2.0, 17.5)
– An unresolved pipeline connection toward the Steam Engine, persisting due to congestion near (2.5, 21.5) with candidate directions (RIGHT, UP, LEFT, DOWN) at varied spacings (2, 3, 4)

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitating power distribution and resource integration.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking Burner Mining Drill’s fast inserter drop to Sink Inserter pickup
– Electricity network formed by Small Electric Poles and associated distribution groups

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Fluid Pipeline Congestion and Connection Issues
  – Relocate or reconfigure obstructing pipe groups to clear the congestion near (2.5, 21.5).
  – Upgrade or switch to underground pipelines/pipe-to-ground modules to bypass above‐ground interference.
  – Reroute the fluid connection from the Boiler toward a less congested region for future Steam Engine placement.
• Inventory and Placement Verification Issues
  – Ensure target placement areas are unobstructed and that sufficient resources are available before attempting placement.
• Power Supply Instability
  – Verify proper alignment and connectivity of electrical network components so that inserters and related devices receive power.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position.
   • Success: Returns the located entity.
   • Failure: Raises an exception if not found.
• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.
• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction for proper alignment.
• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of a resource into the target inventory.
• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required for a fluid connection.
• place_entity_next_to(entity_type: Any, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Any  
  – Places an entity adjacent to the given reference position.
   • Success: The entity is placed correctly.
   • Failure: Raises an exception if a collision is detected.
• place_entity(entity_type: Any, direction: Direction, position: Position) -> Any  
  – Places an entity at the specified position in the given direction.
   • Success: The entity is placed when within the allowed range.
   • Failure: Raises an exception if the target position is invalid.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – holds the offshore pump entity at position (–7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – candidate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – candidate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply.
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – expected location for steam engine placement.
• pipe_count (int) – tracks the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – snapshot of the inventory after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – virtual candidate connection point used during manual pipe placement.
